oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Managing the Organic Dairy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fry, Robert C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: organic dairies
management
protocols
organic milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Management of cows in certified organic dairies requires an understanding of organic protocols and regulations for veterinarians and producers. If a dairyman chooses to manage his or her cows under organic guidelines, specific principles of management that are unique to organic production must be coupled with best-known traditional management practices used in non-organic herds. Management systems and protocols are reviewed for a 600-cow operation in Maryland producing certified organic milk since 1998.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 79-88
